Articles.Content:
Hey @all,


first, my english is not the best so please be patient


I get a access violation on a clean ksp steam installation.


Following changes did not solved the help.
- Reinstallation
- Disabling UAC
- Changing the folder permissions in folder settings
- Changing permissions with cmd
     - ATTRIB -R "F:\Programme\Gaming\Steam\steamapps\common" /s /d
     - ATTRIB -R "F:\Programme\Gaming\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program" /s /d
- Disabled Firewall and Bitdefender
- Changed steam and game location on hdd
- Created a new administration user

crash.dmp
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1uq0Yw1bjY5cXNES3BJQmE4TDg

error.log
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1uq0Yw1bjY5ZHJvaGZ5V1c4SHM

output_log.txt
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1uq0Yw1bjY5bXJYQnc5cXctMWc

System:
https://picload.org/view/rwrcrdwl/spec.png.html

Half a year ago the game works fine for me.
Hope someone can help!

Greetings Max!
 

Edited July 29, 2017 by Maxteric

This is a (heavily) modded install, so this post belongs in the modded support sub-forum:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/forum/70-technical-support-pc-modded-installs/ 

[ModuleManager] Calling B9PartSwitch.B9TankSettings.ModuleManagerPostLoad()
...
AssemblyLoader: Exception loading 'InfernalRobotics': System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException: The classes in the module cannot be loaded.
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.Assembly:GetTypes (bool)
  at System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at AssemblyLoader.LoadAssemblies () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
...
PartLoader: Compiling Part 'DMagicOrbitalScience/UniversalStorage/USGooMat/USMat/dmUSMat'
...
PartLoader: Compiling Part 'IR-2.0.2-Final-Full/GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Legacy/IR_HingeClosed/part/IRHingeClosedScaleable2'
...
PartLoader: Compiling Part 'KAS/Parts/hook_magnet/part/KAS_Hook_Magnet'
...
PartLoader: Compiling Part 'KAX/Parts/KAX_electricProp/KAX_electricProp/KAXelectricprop'
 
(Filename: C:/buildslave/unity/build/artifacts/generated/common/runtime/UnityEngineDebugBindings.gen.cpp Line: 42)

Crash!!!

Crashes with modded installs have two main causes:

  • Incompatible mod versions
  • Running out of memory in 32-bit mode

You seem to be running the 64-bit version, so double check all your mod versions. If you last ran this 6 months ago, it's likely you installed mods for 1.2.2 and then Steam auto-updated you to 1.3.0. You'll probably have to start from scratch and re-download all the mods.
Hi @Maxteric. I took the liberty of moving your question to the section for modded installs. Hope you get some good answers here!
@Maxteric you have a bunch of mods for KSP 1.2.2 and your game version is 1.3. You either need to downgrade to 1.2.2 or upgrade all your mods to 1.3 versions.
